Toward an Open Access Policy for UW-Madison

The University Library Committee at the University of Wisconsin–Madison has formed a working group to develop an Open Access Policy for UW–Madison, through which university researchers would give UW–Madison the right to freely distribute pre-prints of all published journal articles.

See the working group’s instructions from Edward Van Gemert, Vice Provost for Libraries and University Librarian.

On 16 Nov 2015, the University Library Committee adopted a resolution in favor of an Open Access Policy for UW-Madison.

Current UW policies

  • Intellectual property policies and procedures for university research, UW-Madison Graduate School

    Except as required by funding agreements or other University policies, the University does not claim ownership rights in the intellectual property generated during research by its faculty, staff, or students.

  • Copyrightable instructions materials ownership, use and control, UW System

    copyrightable instructional materials developed under the conditions identified in sections II.B.1. and

    1. [no or minimal UW support or involvement] of this policy paper belong solely to the author.

  • Addendum to publication agreements for CIC authors

  • Minds@UW digital collections

  • Good practices for university open-access policies, from Harvard Open Access Project

  • Open doors and open minds: What faculty authors can do to ensure open access to their work through their institution. (White paper from Sparc)

    • Campus policy “choice points” (pdf)

    • Common misconceptions about campus open-access policies (pdf)

  • Copyright FAQ, UW-Madison Libraries

  • Copyright on campus, slides from Brigid Daly, Associate University Legal Counsel, Office of Legal Affairs, UW System

  • SHERPA RoMEO, database of publishers’ policies on copyright and self-archiving

  • OpenDOAR, directory of open access repositories
